{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3550129,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T03:03:49.132Z","cooked":"

Hello all. We arrived at load in today for our first comp of the season, and went to run the robot, and code light on DS never turns green ever, even after redeployment. Code did not change from when we had been running the code fine before comp. We will try to reflash rio right when pits open tomorrow, but I wanted to ask the community for some suggestions. The original error was a pathplanner json parse issue which I fixed by clearing the rio’s deploy folder and redeploying. Now it gives just a general out of memory error.

The easiest way to free up more memory is disabling the system webserver. See docs below.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Java Garbage Collection

Java garbage collection is the process of automatically managing memory for Java objects. The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is responsible for creating and destroying objects, and the garbage collecto...

Are you saying you tried doing it and it didn’t fix the issue?

It seems likely that it’s crashing when loading the auto paths.

No. I am saying the issue isn’t a lack of memory in this specific case, it’s the usage. It shouldn’t instantly be running out. However, back at our shop occasionally it would crash… and your suggestion will be helpful in that sense but probably not for this issue we are having at comp.

Well, we didn’t really solve the issue, we just used the Rio 2 instead. However, since you say the issue is related to pathplanner, if you are doing pathfinding, you could use this guide to offload PathPlanner’s pathfinding functionality onto a coprocessor like the Raspberry Pi. Besides that, I really don’t know what to do. You could perhaps also try to disable to RoboRIO’s web server.
